name: Los Angeles
intro_vibe: The City of Dreams: Where Hollywood glamour meets beach culture and taco trucks under endless sunshine.

general_info.description: Los Angeles is the second-largest city in the United States and the entertainment capital of the world. Famous for Hollywood, beautiful beaches, diverse neighborhoods, and year-round sunshine, LA is a sprawling metropolis where car culture reigns supreme. From celebrity sightings to world-class museums, street tacos to Michelin-starred restaurants, LA offers endless experiences in a city defined by its diversity and creative energy.

etiquette_tips: Car Culture: LA is designed for cars. Public transit exists but is limited. Rent a car or use Uber/Lyft to get around efficiently.
Tipping is Expected: 18-20% at restaurants, $1-2 per drink at bars, 15-20% for taxis/Uber. Servers depend on tips for income.
Sales Tax Added at Register: Prices don't include tax (9.5% in LA). Your bill will be higher than the menu price.
Californians Are Chill: People are generally relaxed, friendly, and informal. 'How are you?' is a greeting, not a real question.
Healthy Living Culture: Juice bars, yoga studios, and vegan restaurants are everywhere. Wellness is taken seriously.
Traffic is No Joke: Rush hour (7-10am, 4-7pm) turns a 20-minute drive into 90 minutes. Plan accordingly or use Waze.

neighborhoods.name: Hollywood
neighborhoods.description: The heart of the entertainment industry. Walk of Fame, Chinese Theatre, and Dolby Theatre (Oscars). Touristy but essential for first-timers.

neighborhoods.name: Santa Monica & Venice
neighborhoods.description: Santa Monica has the iconic pier, beach, and upscale Third Street Promenade. Venice Beach is eclectic with street performers, Muscle Beach, and the skate park.

neighborhoods.name: Beverly Hills & West Hollywood
neighborhoods.description: Beverly Hills is all about Rodeo Drive luxury shopping and celebrity homes. West Hollywood (WeHo) is the LGBTQ+ hub with amazing nightlife and restaurants.

neighborhoods.name: Downtown LA
neighborhoods.description: Revitalized downtown with the Arts District, Grand Central Market, museums, and rooftop bars. Grittier but vibrant and culturally diverse.

logistics.title: Getting Around
logistics.summary: LA is a car city. Rent a car or rely on Uber/Lyft for maximum flexibility.
details: Car Rental: The best way to explore LA. Book ahead for better rates. Be prepared for traffic and parking fees.
Uber / Lyft: Widely available and often cheaper than taxis. Surge pricing during peak hours.
Metro: Limited but improving. Red/Purple Lines connect Hollywood, Downtown, and Koreatown. Not practical for most tourists.
Buses: Extensive but slow. Metro Rapid lines are faster. Best for short local trips.
Biking: Santa Monica and Venice are bike-friendly. Bike rentals available along the beach path.
Parking: Expect to pay $5-30 for parking. Street parking is hard to find. Read signs carefully to avoid tickets.

logistics.title: Scams to Avoid
logistics.summary: LA is generally safe, but tourist traps exist, especially in Hollywood.
details: Hollywood Costumed Characters: Aggressive Elmo, Batman, etc., demand tips after photos. Ignore or negotiate price beforehand.
CD Scammers: People hand you 'free' mixtape CDs, then demand $20. Don't accept anything 'free' on the street.
Parking Meter Scams: Fake 'out of order' signs trick you into overpaying attendants. Use official meters only.
Fake Tickets: Only buy attraction tickets from official sources. Beware of street sellers near theme parks.

logistics.title: Safety Basics
logistics.summary: LA is generally safe in tourist areas, but use common sense in certain neighborhoods.
details: Avoid Skid Row: The area east of Downtown LA has a large homeless population. Stay west of Main Street.
Car Break-Ins: Don't leave valuables visible in your car. Use valet parking or secure lots in tourist areas.
Beach at Night: Most beaches close at sunset. Avoid after dark, especially Venice and Santa Monica.
Earthquakes: Small quakes are common. If a big one hits, drop, cover, and hold on. Stay away from windows.
Emergency Number: 911 for police, fire, and ambulance.

logistics.title: Apps to Download
logistics.summary: These apps will make navigating LA much easier.
details: Waze: Essential for traffic navigation. Avoids traffic and finds fastest routes.
Uber / Lyft: Ride-hailing apps. Cheaper and more convenient than taxis.
SpotHero: Find and reserve parking ahead of time at discounted rates.
OpenTable: Restaurant reservations. Many popular spots book up quickly.
Yelp: Find the best restaurants, bars, and attractions with user reviews.

must_eat.description: California's cult burger chain. Simple menu, fresh ingredients, and a secret menu. Order 'Animal Style' for grilled onions, extra sauce, and pickles.
LA has some of the best Mexican food in the US. Street tacos with carne asada, al pastor, or carnitas are cheap, delicious, and everywhere. Try a taco truck.
LA's Koreatown has the best Korean BBQ outside of Korea. All-you-can-eat (AYCE) options let you grill your own meat at the table. Go hungry.
LA takes coffee seriously. Third-wave coffee shops like Blue Bottle, Intelligentsia, and local roasters serve meticulously crafted lattes and pour-overs.
Historic downtown food hall with diverse vendors. Eggslut (breakfast sandwiches), Sarita's Pupuseria, and Ramen Hood are must-tries.
LA's health-conscious culture means acai bowls are everywhere. Blended acai berries topped with granola, fruit, and honey. Perfect post-beach snack.

items.description: The iconic white letters on Mount Lee. Hike to Griffith Observatory for the best views, or take the Lake Hollywood Park trail to get closer.
Iconic pier with an amusement park, aquarium, and restaurants. The Ferris wheel and arcade are family favorites. Great sunset spot.
Art Deco observatory with free telescopes, planetarium shows, and the best panoramic views of LA and the Hollywood Sign.
Stunning hilltop museum with European paintings, sculptures, and beautiful gardens. Free admission (parking $20). Amazing views of the city.

items.name_en: LACMA (Los Angeles County Museum of Art)
items.description: Largest art museum in the western US. Famous for the 'Urban Light' lamp installation outside. Diverse collection spanning centuries.
Contemporary art museum downtown with works by Warhol, Basquiat, and Kusama's Infinity Mirrored Room. Free admission but book ahead.
Eclectic beach with street performers, Muscle Beach gym, skate park, and bohemian vibes. More chaotic and colorful than Santa Monica.
Upscale beach town with beautiful coastal scenery. Zuma Beach is great for families, El Matador has dramatic cliffs and sea stacks.
World-famous luxury shopping street in Beverly Hills. Gucci, Prada, Chanel, and more. Great for window shopping and celebrity spotting.
Trendy shopping street with vintage stores, streetwear boutiques, and Instagram-worthy murals (like the pink Paul Smith wall).

affiliate_products.title: US Travel Adapter (Type A/B)
affiliate_products.reason: US plugs have two flat pins. If you're from Europe or Asia, you'll need an adapter for all your devices and chargers.

affiliate_products.title: Sunscreen SPF 50+
affiliate_products.reason: LA sunshine is no joke. UV rays are intense year-round. Sunscreen is essential for beach days, hikes, and outdoor sightseeing.

affiliate_products.title: Reusable Water Bottle
affiliate_products.reason: Stay hydrated in the dry California heat. Refill at water fountains instead of buying expensive plastic bottles.
